profiles:
Summary Passionate about science and technology and it’s impact on youth and societies. 
 
A highly motivated leader with demonstrated ability to lead diverse teams to new levels of success, with a solid track record of more than 15 years of diverse Engineering industry experience, mostly with Intel Corp (USA). 
 
Proven ability to successfully analyze a group’s critical business requirements, identify deficiencies and potential opportunities, negotiate with stakeholders and customers to develop win-win innovative and cost-effective solutions for enhancing competitiveness, increasing revenues/TTM, and building strong teams. 
 
Seven time recipient of the Intel’s Divisional Recognition Award (DRA). Hold M.Sc. degree in Computer Systems Engineering, and B.S.E.E degree in Electrical Engineering. 
 
An effective community member and a loyal volunteer with numerous global establishments; Red Cross- teaching refugees in Utah, Chandler city government- Building houses for the under-privilidged, Intel Corp- Science Fair judge, Science Fair coordinator for various schools, Big Brother Big Sister - Providing motivational speeches to high risk school girls, SKMC Hospital + Red Crescent- Syrian refugees knitting project. 
 
Founded and ran Science and Engineering Fair for the American Community School of AbuDhabi, where students were able to compete and have a top 10 presence on a local and international competitions. 
 
As the elected PTA president for the American Community School of AbuDhabi, established a solid structure for the PTA as a governing body, with thorough by-laws and audit procedures. Summary Passionate about science and technology and it’s impact on youth and societies.

Proven ability to successfully analyze a group’s critical business requirements, identify deficiencies and potential opportunities, negotiate with stakeholders and customers to develop win-win innovative and cost-effective solutions for enhancing competitiveness, increasing revenues/TTM, and building strong teams. 
 
Seven time recipient of the Intel’s Divisional Recognition Award (DRA). Hold M.Sc. degree in Computer Systems Engineering, and B.S.E.E degree in Electrical Engineering. 
 
An effective community member and a loyal volunteer with numerous global establishments; Red Cross- teaching refugees in Utah, Chandler city government- Building houses for the under-privilidged, Intel Corp- Science Fair judge, Science Fair coordinator for various schools, Big Brother Big Sister - Providing motivational speeches to high risk school girls, SKMC Hospital + Red Crescent- Syrian refugees knitting project. 
 
Founded and ran Science and Engineering Fair for the American Community School of AbuDhabi, where students were able to compete and have a top 10 presence on a local and international competitions. 
 
As the elected PTA president for the American Community School of AbuDhabi, established a solid structure for the PTA as a governing body, with thorough by-laws and audit procedures. Experience Managing Director Cognitive Computing Ventures November 2014  – Present (10 months) Masdar City, Abu Dhabi Exploring the potential of Cognitive Computing / Artificial Intelligence Documentary Film Producer Freelance August 2014  –  June 2015  (11 months) Produced a documentary on the life of High School kids in Abu Dhabi. The Documentary (dubbed "The Future"​) is the first of it's kind in the region, and will likely be entered into a local Film Festival. 
Recruited and worked with a group of volunteer and paid professionals (Directors, Camera Operators, Editor and co-producer) for the full production.  Science Fair Chair, Parents/Teachers Association President, and Board of Trustees Advisor American Community School of Abu Dhabi May 2010  –  May 2013  (3 years 1 month) Abu Dhabi Launched a new Science Fair initiative for the school, where the students get to compete against American schools in the NESA region. 
Restructured ACS' PTA as the new president, including; operations, financials, strategic relationships, and KPI models. 
Launched several new programs that ties into the new PTA mission. 
Advised the school's board of trustees on several issues, regarding technology roadmap, school policy, student's learning experience, community and staff morale, and more. Engineering and Operations Director Intel Corporation January 2005  –  May 2009  (4 years 5 months) Chipset Group- Chandler, AZ Built and managed a team chartered with enabling various product teams within Intel. The group consistently exceeded business and quality goals mandated Intel’s PC platform product groups and key OEMs like Dell, HP, IBM, and Lenovo. 
Team of 15 engineers and 6 contingent workers, with morale and productivity consistently measuring high according to a group specific health survey, and leadership scores consistently well above the Intel goals as measured by the management feedback surveys. Increased our internal (and inherently external) customer base, achieving a standard interface to Intel’s software products Installation to our OEMs and end users. Chipset Validation Program Manager and Post-si Validation Manager Intel Corporation February 2001  –  January 2005  (4 years) Enterprise Products Group- Chandler, AZ Technically led and directly managed a team of 12 software/hardware engineers and matrix managed a team of 10 senior silicon/software/hardware engineers as IPD’s embedded chipset validation program manager. In this role, was responsible for the back-end activities to enabling PRQ for Intel’s embedded/low-end server chipsets, some of which were at PRQ on their first stepping due to diligent planning, risk management and execution, saving Intel millions of dollars and enabling Intel customers achieve faster TTM. Senior Software Design Engineer Intel Corporation March 1999  –  February 2001  (2 years) Home Products Group- Chandler, AZ Senior software design engineer in a group chartered with developing the architecture of Intel’s Web Appliances and Set-Top boxes crash recovery application. (Architecture is patent pending). Designed and implemented the crash recovery application, which included Linux network protocols such as DHCP and MTFTP, as well as telephony relay device drivers and WFM concepts such as Wake on LAN with a Magic Packet, BIS, etc. Created a new speed optimized the Multicast Trivial File Transfer Protocol (MTFTP) client (patent turned down for submission to open source community) , to work with Intel’s PXE (Pre-boot eXecution Environment) standard MTFTP server that utilizes the UDP layer features, for Intel’s Internet appliances. Systems Engineer Intel Corporation October 1996  –  March 1999  (2 years 6 months) Digital Imaging and Video Division- Chandler, AZ Software Systems Engineer responsible for creating, maintaining, and analyzing requirements to develop the firmware architecture and code for Intel’s CMOS sensor based digital cameras. Successfully ported the Flash File System code by M-Systems to the 80269 microprocessor to support the embedded digital camera firmware development. The effort included analyzing, reverse-engineering and debugging M-System's code. Designed and co- developed image processing flows/pipes with Kodak Engineers, for Intel’s next generation ARM based digital camera. Database Software Field Applications Engineer Gisa Systems- DEC subsidiary December 1991  –  December 1993  (2 years 1 month) Cairo, Egypt At Gisa Systems-DEC subsidiary, a Database Software Field Applications Engineer; responsible for meeting with customers ranging from government senior officials, to heads of universities and senior private sector companies’ officers to collect requirements for their custom VAX/VMS database applications, requirements analysis, design, GUI Specs, implementation (using COBOL), debug /testing, reporting, and customer training and support. Managing Director Cognitive Computing Ventures November 2014  – Present (10 months) Masdar City, Abu Dhabi Exploring the potential of Cognitive Computing / Artificial Intelligence Managing Director Cognitive Computing Ventures November 2014  – Present (10 months) Masdar City, Abu Dhabi Exploring the potential of Cognitive Computing / Artificial Intelligence Documentary Film Producer Freelance August 2014  –  June 2015  (11 months) Produced a documentary on the life of High School kids in Abu Dhabi. The Documentary (dubbed "The Future"​) is the first of it's kind in the region, and will likely be entered into a local Film Festival. 
Recruited and worked with a group of volunteer and paid professionals (Directors, Camera Operators, Editor and co-producer) for the full production. Experience Senior Software Design Engineer Intel Corporation January 2013  – Present (2 years 8 months) WOA Senior Software Design Engineer Texas Instruments January 2012  –  December 2012  (1 year) Redmond, WA My primary role is to design, implement and debug a Windows 8 RT AVStream camera driver for two embedded cameras (front/back) running on the TI OMAP 4470 ARM SOC. I am familiar with related multimedia drivers (decoders/encoders). I am familiar with the OpenMAX interface from A9 to M3 cores that run TI’s Ducati multimedia subsystem. I am familiar with i2c camera interface and have an understanding of different camera encoding technologies. I am responsible for implementing camera power management via UEFI and ACPI/ASL. I have a strong background in writing WDM/WDF drivers, USB, and kernel debugging with WinDbg. I have an understanding of Win8 RT Metro app development and camera device app. Windows Senior Software Design Engineer Microsoft September 2006  –  October 2011  (5 years 2 months) Redmond,WA My primary role was to design, implement and debug Windows Vista/7/8 features related to the Windows USB driver stack and new Windows 8 Portable Workspace feature. This work consists of writing feature design specifications, code implementation per the design specifications, unit tests for each feature and debugging of any issues in the implementation.  
Feature areas that I have worked on are: USB boot crashdump driver, USB driver stack, 1394 driver stack, Wireless USB driver stack, WinUSB driver, driver telemetry, user-mode API design/implementation, various Win32 applications and power and performance measurement testing. I am able to quickly learn new technologies/processes. Windows DDK Escalation Engineer/Tech Lead Microsoft January 1992  –  September 2006  (14 years 9 months) My primary role was to provide end to end support for external device driver developer customers. I provided solutions to difficult customer problems through customer interaction, debugging, code workarounds, bug fixes and sample code. I was a technical presenter at DevCon 2003 and delivered a one hour talk titled “Writing 1394 Device Drivers” to 75+ driver developers. Windows Software Development Kit (SDK) Support Engineer Microsoft March 1991  –  January 1992  (11 months) Responsible for helping external developers write/debug Win 16/32 GDI/printing applications. This work consists of writing feature design specifications, code implementation per the design specifications, unit tests for each feature and debugging of any issues in the implementation.  
Feature areas that I have worked on are: USB boot crashdump driver, USB driver stack, 1394 driver stack, Wireless USB driver stack, WinUSB driver, driver telemetry, user-mode API design/implementation, various Win32 applications and power and performance measurement testing.
